title: Comparing forces on top and bottom of block

content.prompt: How does the magnitude of the force exerted by the top box on the bottom box compare with the magnitude of the force exerted by the bottom box on the top box for each of the stacks?

choices.label: The two magnitudes are always equal in each of the stacks.
The two magnitudes are always different in each of the stacks.
The two magnitudes are equal when the boxes have equal mass and different when the boxes have different masses.
The two magnitudes are equal when the elevator is moving at constant speed and different when it is accelerating.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
